concept_data.title: Vice-President of the European Parliament
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service

summary: The "Vice-President of the European Parliament" (VP of the EP) serves as a key figure within the institutional framework of the European Union, specifically under the category of EU institutions and European civil service. The Vice-President assists in presiding over parliamentary sessions, ensuring adherence to procedural rules, and representing the Parliament in external relations. This role is vital for maintaining legislative order and facilitating dialogue among Member States. As a redirect to the preferred term "Vice-President of the EP," this concept underscores the importance of leadership within the Parliament's governance structure, contributing to the EU's legislative process and democratic accountability.

metadata.category: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service
